title: Why Order is guaranteed to lose
body:
#Disclaimer
**Before reading this post note that these are generalizations and that if you and/or your friends are an exception that is already accounted for later.**

I mean Riot directly states Riven stands for Order, Progress and Love, with stricter rules
Yasuo stands for chaos, death and destruction, ruining everything to rebuild an impossible world.
So why will Yasuo win?

Simple, this is the internet. The 'good guys' have always lost every single fight of popularity. 

Zerg is the most popular race in Starcraft
Sith are more popular than Jedi
Lissandra was more popular than Ashe in their event
Horde outweighs Alliance players heavily in WoW

Even modern media portrays the rebels as almost always being the good guys.

Why? The media industry, especially on the internet, is largely ruled by young players/viewers. These are people living at home who are dealing with their parents every single day, a representations of order in their minds, same goes for the schools they go to. It is well known that for reasons like this most young people are far more rebellious. What is more is on the internet you have a whole lot of them trying to act like they are special by acting edgy, pretending they are mental, or talking constantly about how cool evil is. 

Young people like chaos. And some chaos is healthy, it stirs up society when there is foul play afoot and can lead to healthy revolutions. But young people do not see it this way, that is not Yasuo's goal in this event. He has made his goal clear, it is not to cause some chaos to shake up an order he feels is corrupt and rebuild a new order. It is mass destruction and murder leading into a chaotic world that he considers ideal. Pretty cool for a villain honestly, almost had me on his side.

But why did I side with Riven? Because honestly, on the internet. Love, Compassion, Order, Progress, these are the 'rebellious' actions on the internet. Because everybody pictures themselves some sort of chaotic crazy person, that has become the normal attitude and side to pick. Sadly, this event was predictable from the start, I said it in another post long before the bar moved in Yasuo's favor. 

While there are exceptions to the rule, young people who prefer Riven or order. In general the mass number of young people with far more free time for games is still a bunch of young people who want chaos and disorder. They still want to see their cool guy beat that overly controlling girl. Regardless of their actual goals or moralities, they will create any justification why his side should be picked even in a realistic scenario.

Meanwhile people like me who want to side with Riven for moral reasons and because I like the character well... I work two jobs and go to school. My op.gg will tell I do not have much time for LoL compared to dedicated players. Sure there are exceptions, people with jobs who are fully responsible adults and just side with Yasuo because it is fun or they prefer villain characters. But we are talking about the generalizations of the masses that are playing the game and leaning the bar, not the couple exceptions that may read this.

I have seen it honestly in dozens upon dozens of fandoms. A couple older people who try to be cool by picking the dark side, most young people picking the darkside with a few exceptions who just like the light side more, then a bunch of older people too busy to be dedicated fans but picking the light side.

For clarity I am young myself, in my mid/low twenties. I just came out of my edgy darkside period a year or so ago. So it's not like I am some 30-50 something year old judging all them youngins or something. 

So anyway, that is my view on why chaos was assured to win from the start, you may disagree but here is some Order art to pursued you.

http://www.lol-wallpapers.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Dawnbringer-Riven-by-SongJiKyo-HD-Wallpaper-Background-Fan-Art-Artwork-League-of-Legends-lol.jpg?noredirect

http://www.lol-wallpapers.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Dawnbringer-Riven-by-Ayiori-Kaipng-HD-Wallpaper-Background-Fan-Art-Artwork-League-of-Legends-lol-500x383.jpg?noredirect

Besides, Yasuo is also about control. You don't get to make your own choices when a madman destroys everything and kills everyone so...

Even when I was little, I was always a weird kid; I have a ridiculous level of empathy, to the point I can't even hurt a fly (I think it's a good thing though, I wish more people were like that), and I always treated characters in games as if they had feelings -- refusing to play bad guys or use cruel attacks (even now, at 23, I can't play a cruel or evil character without feeling all kinds of weird, and I try to avoid it if I can). 

I was always drawn to the idea of a hero. But not a hero that's vain and boastful, like the cliche, rather a hero that's just helping people because it's natural to them, even if they don't have fancy powers, don't get recognition, or any of that -- even if it's just helping with little, almost mundane things.

As for your WoW example, I played Alliance for 9 years, Horde for two. When I was Horde, I could never stand how warlike and brutal most of the races were -- they had some redeeming qualities, like their incredible sense of honor, but I only ever liked the Tauren and Blood Elves. I played mostly NE and Gnome, but every char of mine became a Panda when MOP launched (I thought they were adorable). 

So, irrelevant ranting aside, I'm a young person who has always naturally gravitated towards the good guys, and picked Order without any hesitation.
